update.description:
This pull request makes it possible to embed a GZ3D simulation / log playback scene into another webpage. 

All files needed to embed GzWeb on another page are bundled into a single file `gz3d.full.iface.js`, which can be included on any site. This file does not bring UI elements, so downstream sites can interact with the simulation through their own UI using events.

### Background

GzWeb was originally designed to work as a complete website., and as such:

* Includes GUI elements, which use jQuery and AngularJS, and many classes on the code interact directly with these elements.
* Assumes the scene takes up the whole window.
* Assumes all content is served from the current URL: both static content and simulation updates coming through websockets.

### Changes

This pull request is being broken into smaller ones to facilitate review and decrease the chance of introducing bugs. The following pull requests are part of this one:

* ~~Pull request #147 : Unify emitters, decouple Iface and Gui~~
* ~~Pull request #150 : Scene custom size~~
* ~~Pull request #152 : Make radial menu optional on scene~~

Other changes contained in this PR:

* Generation of `gz3d.iface.full.js` and `gz3d.iface.full.min.js` when `npm run update` is run. These files are not being version controlled.
* Add a demo (see below)
* Move `isTouchDevice` to `gz.js` (from pull request #141)
* Fixes to the URLs of materials
* :warning: **controversial** :warning: : Changed a couple lines on `ColladaLoader.js` - we may want to pull an upstream version instead, which will require more changes.

### Demo

`examples/embedded_scene.html ` shows the intended use of the new files. To run the demo:

1. Launch `gzserver`
1. Launch gzweb backend with `npm start`
1. Open the demo on a browser : `firefox examples/embedded_scene.html`
1. Fill in the URL box with the GzWeb backend URL and press `Connect`
1. A scene will be created and connected to the simulation which is running on another server. The example also shows how to subscribe to information from the server (world stats) and to send requests to the server (play/pause):

![exampleembeddedplay.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/r77Gja/images/340720946-exampleembeddedplay.gif)
update.title: Embeddable GZ3D

content.raw: I'll merge this PR like this and address the naming in a new PR
content.html: I'll merge this PR like this and address the naming in a new PR

content.raw:
I just noticed that I also had to make some changes to `ColladaLoader.js` before. I added this note to keep track of it:

`// NOTE: modified from original ColladaLoader.js.r86`
content.html:
I just noticed that I also had to make some changes to ColladaLoader.js before. I added this note to keep track of it:

// NOTE: modified from original ColladaLoader.js.r86

content.raw:
Nice catch, it was removed by mistake, re-added and fixed the comment: cbd9a99.

While testing this, I noticed that since we're not capturing events on the whole document anymore, the browser's context menu was not being suppressed. I solved it adding `oncontextmenu="return false;"` to `index.html`.
content.html:
Nice catch, it was removed by mistake, re-added and fixed the comment: cbd9a99.

While testing this, I noticed that since we're not capturing events on the whole document anymore, the browser's context menu was not being suppressed. I solved it adding oncontextmenu="return false;" to index.html.

content.raw:
The wildcard pulls all files in alphabetic order, but Three.js needs to come on the top so it is defined before everything else.

Grunt handles uniqueness and negations in the end for us.
content.html:
The wildcard pulls all files in alphabetic order, but Three.js needs to come on the top so it is defined before everything else.

Grunt handles uniqueness and negations in the end for us.

1. Launch gzweb backend with `npm start`
1. Fill in the URL box with the GzWeb backend URL and press Connect
content.html:
Do you want to add the instructions from PR description here? Something like:

  1. Launch gzserver
  2. Launch gzweb backend with npm start
  3. Fill in the URL box with the GzWeb backend URL and press Connect

content.html: we don't need mousedown? this prevents selecting models right?

content.raw:
Fixed OBJ/MTL texture loading for various schemes on 3b661f8. This fixes issue #114:

![objgzweb2.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/r77Gja/images/2462685011-objgzweb2.png)
content.html: Fixed OBJ/MTL texture loading for various schemes on 3b661f8. This fixes issue #114:
